msDesc.head: Geoffrey of Viterbo, Pantheon; Giovanni Boccaccio, De casibus virorum illustrium; John Mandeville, Voyage d'outre mer. Germany (Eberbach, Cistercian abbey), 1454.

msItem.author: Geoffrey of Viterbo
msItem.title: Pantheon
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula prime partis libri godfridi viterbiensis
msItem.colophon: Fol. 336v: Explicit liber pantheon ... Procurante Reuerendo in christo patre et domino domino Thilmanno Abbate monasterii Eberbacensis xixº Scriptus per fratrem Iohannem de Oistrich [Oestrich Winkel im Rheingau] Anno dominj Mºccccº liiijo.

msItem.author: Giovanni Boccaccio
msItem.title: De casibus virorum illustrium
msItem.note: (extract on the Templars: IX.xxi-xxii and xxiii.1-4)
msItem.rubric: Johannes bocacij libro nono de casibus virorum illustrium hec scribit de domino Jacobo de Molay magistro templario

listBibl.bibl: ed. P. G. Ricci and V. Zaccaria, 1983 = Tutte le opere di Giovanni Boccaccio, ed. V. Branca, IX, 822-834

msItem.author: John Mandeville
msItem.title: Voyage d'outre mer
msItem.note: Latin tr., with list of chapters (fols 340r-342v).
msItem.incipit: (fols. 342v) Cum terre Iherosolimitana terra promissionis filiorum dei dignior cunctis mundi terris sit habenda
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Itinerariuis a terra Anglie in partes Iherosolimitanas et in ulteriores transmarinas editus primo in lingwa gallicana a domino Johanne de mandeuilla milite suo auctore Anno incarnacionis domini M CCC lv in ciuitate leodien' et paulo post in eadem ciuitate translatus in dictam formam latinam
msItem.note: So-called 'fifth (Liège) translation': see J. W. Bennett, The rediscovery of Sir John Mandeville (1954), 301-10, listing the present manuscript (no. 27).

supportDesc.foliation: iii, 1-396 in modern (19th-cent.) pencil. Fol. 339 repeats, with two leaves numbered fols 339a and 339b.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruling in single column of unruled 31-40 lines (occasional double columns). Ruled space 145 c. 85-100

handDesc.handNote: Two main hands: (i) Hybrida, fols. 1r-60v; (ii) Cursive, fols. 61r-393v; 1454. Colophon dated 1454 by monk Johannes de Oistrich (f. 336v) stating item 1 was copied at Eberbach Cistercian abbey for Abbot Tillmann von Johannisberg (r. 1442-1456).

binding.p: Brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard for Archbp. Laud, 1637–1639. Rust-mark from the staple of a former chained binding, fol. 393.

history.provenance: Eberbach, Cistercian Abbey of the Virgin Mary: Colophon dated 1454 by monk Johannes de Oistrich (f. 336v) stating item 1 was copied at Eberbach for Abbot Tillmann von Johannisberg (r. 1442-1456); part of the abbot's library, early 16th-century ex-libris inscription at the lower margin of f. 1r: ‘Liber Virginis gloriose. In Ebirbach. Hic est Marie. Ad Vsus. Abbatis Ebirbacensis’. Probably not identifiable in the catalogue of 1502 (Palmer, Zistenzienser, 272, 297).
William Laud, 1573–1645: Ex-libris inscription of Archbp. Laud, dated 1638, at the lower margin of fol. iii-v.
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian as part of his third donation, dispatched on 28 June 1639.

recordHist.source: Description by Alison Ray and Matthew Holford, Jan. 2024. Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 512 Quarto Catalogue, col. 513 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 56

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: A. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts in Oxford Libraries (1984), no. 632

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for Mainz digitization project.
Date corrected with reference to Watson.
